creator.name: Particuliere West-Indische Bank Suriname
creator.name_english: Private West Indian Bank in Suriname
creator.his_func:
The decision establishing the Bank in 1828 was one of the measures to improve the economic situation in Suriname. The Private West Indian Bank was a private institution, but its control and management were in the hands of government officials. The bank owned plantations or managed them, such as Voorzorg (Saramacca), Catharina Sophia, Mijn Vermaak and Rustenburg.

Quite soon after establishment the bank could not meet its obligations. It was not able to have a positive impact on the circulation of money. In 1848 it was decided to liquidate it. This was accomplished at the end of 1870.
